website_summaries.verdict: Nikon's flagship dSLR ranks among the best 35mm-format cameras currently made, but some pros may take umbrage with its less-than-full-frame sensor.
pros: very low noise even at high ISOs

customer_reviews.title: I can't say enough good about this camera
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good about this camera. It arrived on time and in perfect condition. In my opinion I got a great deal for what I paid. This D2xs will serve me well for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Nice full sensor camera
customer_reviews.text: It is literally just the camera body. The hand strap would have been nice to have but for the price I paid I wont complain too much. It is a great back up system for me to use as a second camera or for second shooter when I need two photographers.
customer_reviews.author: H. Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D2xs flawless.
customer_reviews.text: Nikon D2xs is like new and works flawlessly! For an older pro body, this unit performs very well! Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David S. Stranahan

customer_reviews.title: Great Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera was a great camera for me. It was my first Nikon camera and I liked it. I moved on to another Nikon camera. And I got a great deal from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: rjoseph2

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, novice photographer
customer_reviews.text: The camera is fine, but I have to learn quite a bit about the operation of it as I am used to shooting in an auto mode.
customer_reviews.author: SHIRLEY W. BENNETT

customer_reviews.title: very sharp if you put a good leans on it
customer_reviews.text: The D2Xs is ridiculously strong and will last without issues. You can do anything you want to do, if you learn how to use it. I'll be using mine for the rest of my life. I've had it about 5 years....very tough, very reliable, very sharp if you put a good leans on it. I'm getting sharp 16x24 prints, and could go bigger if I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Good Investment
customer_reviews.text: I know how to get good deals on the D2x and D2xs. I will not sell it. This will soon be my back up camera when I get a D3 or D3x. I had a D60 then D80 and then D2x and now for a year now, the D2xs. D2x and D2xs are about 90% the same. It is a top of the line camera and also the last of the professional DX cameras (maybe for now). You can not go wrong with this investment. You can get a D3 for 4 or 5k so if you are buy a D2x or D2xs above 3k, you are crazy.
customer_reviews.author: GCPhotographers

customer_reviews.title: Beyond Best
customer_reviews.text: I have been a professional photographer for more than 42 years and a photography teacher for 38 years. This is simply, the best camera I have ever owned. This is the first audio focus camera that focuses faster than me, its a bit heavy, but I'm a bit older. Couple this camera with a fast lens, (f1.4D, f1.8D, f2.0D, f2.8D), and if the pictures are not good, then its you. With the new Nikon D3 coming out in November 2007, this camera will be available used as well as new, get one you will not be disappointed. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Richard Stromberg

customer_reviews.title: A Little Confused
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the D2x for several years. It is still a great performer, albeit more limited now since the advent of the D300, D700, and D3s (all of which I own also). I will never get rid of my D2x as it is, as I said, a great performer...workhorse build, excellent low iso performance, overall still produces outstanding images. What confuses me though is that Amazon is still selling it new for @$5,800. What's up with that. You can find a pristine copy on ebay for probably under $1,500. That, in my opinion, would be the best bet for anyone interested in this Nikon gem.
customer_reviews.author: jszee

customer_reviews.title: High ISO is not good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one in gray market. the picture quality is not good as D300. review screen is small.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: WHY
customer_reviews.text: Why on earth would anyone spend 4k on this when you could spend the SAME 4k and get D3.....which is superior in EVERY way?????? Please tell me? If you have 4k and are in the market for DSL, get the D3.
customer_reviews.author: R. Houser

product_meta.title: Nikon D2Xs Digital SLR Camera
product_meta.description: With a new color calibrated 2.5" LCD and wide viewing angle, increased battery life per charge, and new menu system the D2Xs continues from where the D2X left off! Compatible Lenses - AF Nikkor (including AF-S, DX, VR and D-/G-type) - All functions possible; D-type Manual-Focus Nikkor - All functions except autofocus and some exposure modes available; AF Nikkor other than D-/G-type - All functions except 3D Color Matrix Metering II and 3D Multi-Sensor Balanced Fill-Flash possible; AI-P Nikkor - All functions except 3D Color Matrix Metering II, 3D Multi-Sensor Balanced Fill-Flash and AF possible; Non-CPU AI Nikkor - Usable in [A] or [M] mode with Matrix-Metering, Center-Weighted and Spot metering available Improved 3D Color Matrix Metering II with more refined exposure evaluation algorithms and larger database for difficult-to-meter scenes Multi-CAM 2000 Autofocus system provides 11-area autofocus system with group dynamic AF, close-subject priority dynamic AF, close subject in a group priority dynamic AF and Lock-On Flash - Nikon Creative Lighting System support for Nikon Speedlights SB-800, SB-600 for full i-TTL flash control with Nikon Advanced Wireless Lighting, color control, FP High-Speed Sync, Modeling flash and more Compatible with the The Coolwalker Digital Storage Photo Viewer - Store up to 10,000 digital photos on the 30GB hard drive and view them on the high-quality 2.5 inch TFT color monitor. Stores JPEG, TIFF and other major image file formats, including NEF files Power Requirements - Rechargeable Li-ion Battery EN-EL4a (11.1V DC), Quick Charger MH-21, AC Adapter EH-6 (optional) Unit Weight (without batteries) - 2.4 lbs
feature_bullets: Supplied Accessories - Type-B Focusing Screen, Rechargeable Li-ion Battery EN-EL4a, Quick Charger MH-21, Body Cap, Camera Strap AN-D2Xs, Audio Video Cable EG-D2, USB Cable UC-E4, LCD Monitor Cover BM-3, Battery Chamber Cover BL-1, PictureProject software CD-ROM

Image Size - Full Image - [L] 4,288 x 2,848-pixel / [M] 3,216 x 2,136-pixel / [S] 2,144 x 1,424-pixel, High Speed Cropped Image - [L] 3,216 x 2,136-pixel / [M] 2,400 x 1,600-pixel / [S] 1,600 x 1,064-pixel
Storage Media - Supports CompactFlash Card (Type I / II) and Microdrive
Exposure Control - Programmed Auto with Flexible Program [P], Shutter-Priority Auto [S], Aperture-Priority Auto [A], Manual [M]

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars21 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
